content.description: Jugs at the bottom lead to a grainy slab at the top.
content.location: This is the second bolted line in from the north side of the wall, and is directly left of a large arete/crack.

content.description: This is a great route that requires quick thinking and quick movement. The crux is in the transition from jugs to the face climbing near the second bolt. Clipping the second bolt can be pretty sketchy as there aren't many positive holds to clip from. You can avoid a sketchy first clip by starting on the left to clip then down climb and start the route from below the first bolt.
content.location: Furthest route on the left of Post wall. Start is located at the base of a small tree.

content.description: Crux is two moves off the ground to a small roof pullover.  Nice jugs to start then tapers off to crimps.
content.protection:
6 Glue in Wire "bolts"

2 Glue in Wire Anchors
content.location: Just to the right of Whitewater - In-between whitewater.10a and the Young and the Pampered.10b/c

content.description: fun route right of Billy Goat
content.protection: 8 glue in bolts, chain anchor at top
content.location: start of line is right of Billy Goat

content.description: This route has a great start then kind of peters out in the end. The crux is over after the 2nd bolt is clipped and the holds get much bigger from then on. A fun varied route.

Just to the right of Quit Your Whining. The crux is right off the ground past the first two bolts. The difficulty really depends on how short or tall you are. Guidebook suggests 11a. In reality, the difficulty is short with one or two moves on small crimps and then eases up to 5.9.

This climb starts in the crack just right of Lion of the north. Climb up the crack for 1 bolt and then traverse out right onto the face. Now just up the edges to the anchors, pulling over small bulge near the top.

Note: there is a direct start to this route as well. Start in the face directly under the route and clip 1 bolt then it joins the regular route. This variation is more around 5.10b.
content.location: Between Lion of the North and Rolling Thunder.

content.description: This is a fun route with a crux down low. The crux is moving over the second bolt. Scoot out to the right and is a few liebacks to surmount most of the troubles. There is a small runout from the 4th to the 5th bolt on this route. The ground is pretty easy going though.
content.location: This route is just left of 'Quit Your Whining'.

content.description: A one move wonder route. Climb up past 2 bolts to the roof.  Pull over the roof and up the face beyond to the top.  Doesn't get climbed enough so the upper face has quite a bit of lichen on it, although it is really easy climbing up there.  The roof isn't nearly as hard as it looks especially if you throw in a good heel hook.
content.location: Just right of Mrs. Butterworth on the Post Wall.

content.description: A good, juggy climb with a tough roof finish. you can also turn the roof to the right and take a couple letters off the grade.
content.location: In the middle of the Post Wall. It's the second bolt line over from the arete

climbs.name: End Piece Goes to Night Flight

content.description: A route which is better avoided:  Clip an oddly placed bolt in a large chalkstone/flake feature. Then climb up and over crappy rock to a moss covered slab. Now tread lightly near the bulge beneath the anchor, there is loose rock here.
content.location: Climbs next to a large butchered tree about 5 feet off the ground

content.description: Bolted route on the far right side of Post Wall.
content.location: To the right of Step it UP.

content.description: A good practice lead route for beginners or a nice warmup route for harder climbs on Post Wall. This route climbs up through in-cuts and past a small bulge near the top which is easily surmounted via jugs.
content.location: Furthest right climb on Post Wall. Note the red hangers that have been spray painted.

content.description: Starts just left of Frostbite. Climb up a steep face passing 4 bolts, then instead of traversing left onto face around upper roof, head directly for the roof passing a single glue-in bolt. Once at the roof, clip the last bolt protecting the crux (Clipping it might be a bit tricky for shorter folks). The crux involves big moves on small crimps.
A fun climb on good rock. Starts just left of Frostbite.  Climb up steep face passed 4 bolts, then traverse left onto face around upper roof.
content.location: This climb is between "End Piece Goes to Night Flight" and "Frostbite".

content.description: Follow two bolts to to some nice jugs under the roof, allowing to clip the third bolt prior to pulling over the roof.  Continue over easier ground to the anchor.
content.location: Left most of two routes pulling through a roof about 10 feet off the ground
